alert.note: Alert for Richland (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 9:29PM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Red River of the North at Wahpeton affecting Wilkin and Richland Counties. Red River of the North at Pembina affecting Kittson and Pembina Counties. Red River of the North at Drayton affecting Pembina, Kittson, Marshall and Walsh Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Red River of the North near Hickson affecting Cass County. Red River of the North at Oslo affecting Polk, Walsh, Marshall and Grand Forks Counties. Red River of the North at Halstad affecting Norman and Traill Counties. Red River of the North at East Grand Forks affecting Polk and Grand Forks Counties. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Cass and Clay Counties. Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie affecting Richland County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red River of the North at Wahpeton. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.5 feet, North Main Street and bridge closed (Breckenridge). * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 11.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM CDT Tuesday was 11.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.0 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
